title: xioxian
author: xioxian
created_time: April 24, 2023, 10:28:18 AMLast edit: April 26, 2023, 03:20:51 PM by xioxian
content: GM guys, im still fairly new to posting here so forgive me if this isn't formatted correctly! I have this miner i purchased from China, i have very little information on so any help finding out exactly what the brand is would be a great help, i have shared as much possible details as i can with you all.I replace all the sockets on the dashboards as they began to melt, its important to note that the miner was fully functional.After the replacement of the sockets, the miner is up and running and displaying, yet refusing to being mining. Below i have attached all the information from the miners dashboard and the CGminer logs.Any help highly appreciated and sorry about my formatting, the Google drive link is a image of the miner in question!https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Br9sKNC4cBDrOYC1ck_F76LMj1nV8guF/view?usp=share_linkTIAMiner Model矿机类型ZTS5190806020790OS操作系统LinuxHardware Version硬件版本v40Kernel Version内核版本Linux rockchip comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Based on the error "1 configure slave: 70 data 1 falied No such device or address" it seems all hashboard is not detected properly.Do you mind to try to disconnect all wires and replug them back and check all sockets and plugs are all clean. Also check the fans if both of them running fine.I notice that the image that you posted above is different. I thought that it was an Antminer s5.It looks like a Chinese version of the s5 miner?Next time make sure to put all logs inside the insert code tag because your post above looks messy.

comments.author: xioxian
comments.body: Hey friend, ill be sure to do this momentarily! and no, i have several brands, but all the information i have for this one is "S5" lol! Its from China aswell i can confirm that!

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: If I am not wrong, if your ASIC is like on your photo, it could be a S15 instead of a S5.Antminer S5 :Antminer S15 :Are you sure that you did a correct job when replacing the sockets ? It could explain this error Did you try to isolate the issue with only 1 hashboard connected each try and with different ribbon data cables ?Do you have the opportunity to try with another PSU ?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: xioxian on April 24, 2023, 02:10:16 PMHey friend, ill be sure to do this momentarily! and no, i have several brands, but all the information i have for this one is "S5" lol! Its from China aswell i can confirm that!I have never seen S5 units that looks t15/s15 as mentioned above.Did you flash this unit with S5 firmware? if you did then this might be the reason why plugs/sockets are burnt.If I were you check the control board of this unit and post the image here so that we know the exact model of this unit and to find the right firmware for this model.

comments.author: xioxian
comments.body: Sorry about delay guys. So the information i have the miner is the original photo i posted, its identical to this. I have attached links to my drive containing an a exact photo of my miner, please forgive me as i dont have a smartphone currently so i cannot share my own photos!This issue is 100% since the plugs began to melt. There was no damage prior to the plug replacement and the miner was hashing fine on all boards.As for firmware, i purchased this amongst 3 or 4 others, The vast majority of them were Bitmain S9s, i only managed to find, source and flash firmware for those models.Im yet to find any information online regarding this miner in question.As for the quality of the replacement of plugs, it was my first time soldering. Im more than happy to replace them and try again.As for data cables, psu cables and so forth i have reseated all cables to and from psu, control board, and dashboards.I have several other PSUs, i have one spare Innosilicon T3+ psu. Im still unsure as to weather i could mix brands of psus with different brands of miners, is this possible to rule out the PSU?Screenshot to my dashboard, log after re-seat of cables: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1TzYkDxLsCkC-4vGN0h0oTMnBal1ZRPm_?usp=share_linkPS. I just wanna say thank you very much guys. Im fairly new to this a year deep to be exact. Im more than happy to reward those who help me. TIA!EDIT: Please note, my miner is not as the two the kind gent/lady posted above!

comments.author: xioxian

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: It looks like a cheetah s5, not the Antminer, and based on my old post it's a Zhongtian s5 miner. I can't find support for this unit here or a website out there.There is someone here who shares the firmware for Aisen A1 and maybe this one will work here's the post below- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5206886.msg54490620#msg54490620If this doesn't work try to contact Zeusbtc and maybe they do have firmware of this unit the only problem is they don't give it for free

comments.author: xioxian
comments.body: Thanks kind sir. I have resolderd two of the boards and still the same codes. Could this be firmware?EDIT: So i downloaded that firmware, flashed it with no issues. comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: According to your logs the control board seems can't detect all hashboards properly.Have you ever tried to change the pool instead of using miningrigrentals?You can try https://solo.ckpool.org/ or ViaBTC pool just to test and maybe the issue is due to the pool you are using.

comments.author: xioxian
comments.body: No luck with that. Is it possible i chose the wrong solder or flux?https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/393138762971https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/225464766264?var=524458659746

comments.author: xioxian
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on April 26, 2023, 05:20:46 PMAccording to your logs the control board seems can't detect all hashboards properly.Have you ever tried to change the pool instead of using miningrigrentals?You can try https://solo.ckpool.org/ or ViaBTC pool just to test and maybe the issue is due to the pool you are using.So i remove connectors on one dashboard and took 2 hours on re fitting and removing all the flux. comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: xioxian on April 26, 2023, 05:35:27 PMNo luck with that. Is it possible i chose the wrong solder or flux?Any flux should work and about the soldering lead, it is also fine.I can't help you furthermore due to less support for this model unit.There is nothing we can do but to contact a professional ASIC repair technician that you can find somewhere near your area.You can check this https://www.zeusbtc.com/ASIC-Miner-Repair/Then look for a repair center near your location.

comments.author: xioxian
comments.body: Fortunately i have it covered from where i purchased it so ill be sure to return, thank you sir!
